trans-unit.source: Run Background tasks with WebJobs
trans-unit.target: Run Background tasks with WebJobs

trans-unit.source: Learn how to run background tasks in Azure web apps.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to run background tasks in Azure web apps.

trans-unit.source: Run Background tasks with WebJobs
trans-unit.target: Run Background tasks with WebJobs

trans-unit.source: Overview
trans-unit.target: Overview

trans-unit.source: You can run programs or scripts in WebJobs in your [App Service](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=529714) web app in three ways: on demand, continuously, or on a schedule.
trans-unit.target: You can run programs or scripts in WebJobs in your [App Service](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=529714) web app in three ways: on demand, continuously, or on a schedule.

trans-unit.source: There is no additional cost to use WebJobs.
trans-unit.target: There is no additional cost to use WebJobs.

trans-unit.source: This article shows how to deploy WebJobs by using the [Azure Portal](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=529715).
trans-unit.target: This article shows how to deploy WebJobs by using the [Azure Portal](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=529715).

trans-unit.source: For information about how to deploy by using Visual Studio or a continuous delivery process, see [How to Deploy Azure WebJobs to Web Apps](websites-dotnet-deploy-webjobs.md).
trans-unit.target: For information about how to deploy by using Visual Studio or a continuous delivery process, see [How to Deploy Azure WebJobs to Web Apps](websites-dotnet-deploy-webjobs.md).

trans-unit.source: The Azure WebJobs SDK simplifies many WebJobs programming tasks.
trans-unit.target: The Azure WebJobs SDK simplifies many WebJobs programming tasks.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [What is the WebJobs SDK](websites-dotnet-webjobs-sdk.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [What is the WebJobs SDK](websites-dotnet-webjobs-sdk.md).

trans-unit.source: Acceptable file types for scripts or programs
trans-unit.target: Acceptable file types for scripts or programs

trans-unit.source: The following file types are accepted:
trans-unit.target: The following file types are accepted:

trans-unit.source: .cmd, .bat, .exe (using windows cmd)
trans-unit.target: .cmd, .bat, .exe (using windows cmd)

trans-unit.source: .ps1 (using powershell)
trans-unit.target: .ps1 (using powershell)

trans-unit.source: .sh (using bash)
trans-unit.target: .sh (using bash)

trans-unit.source: .php (using php)
trans-unit.target: .php (using php)

trans-unit.source: .py (using python)
trans-unit.target: .py (using python)

trans-unit.source: .js (using node)
trans-unit.target: .js (using node)

trans-unit.source: .jar (using java)
trans-unit.target: .jar (using java)

trans-unit.source: Create an on demand WebJob in the portal
trans-unit.target: Create an on demand WebJob in the portal

trans-unit.source: In the **Web App** blade of the [Azure Portal](http://portal.azure.com), click **All settings > WebJobs** to show the **WebJobs** blade.
trans-unit.target: In the **Web App** blade of the [Azure Portal](http://portal.azure.com), click **All settings > WebJobs** to show the **WebJobs** blade.

trans-unit.source: WebJob blade
trans-unit.target: WebJob blade

trans-unit.source: Click **Add**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Add**.

trans-unit.source: The **Add WebJob** dialog appears.
trans-unit.target: The **Add WebJob** dialog appears.

trans-unit.source: Add WebJob blade
trans-unit.target: Add WebJob blade

trans-unit.source: Under **Name**, provide a name for the WebJob.
trans-unit.target: Under **Name**, provide a name for the WebJob.

trans-unit.source: The name must start with a letter or a number and cannot contain any special characters other than "-" and "_".
trans-unit.target: The name must start with a letter or a number and cannot contain any special characters other than "-" and "_".

trans-unit.source: In the **How to Run** box, choose **Run on Demand**.
trans-unit.target: In the **How to Run** box, choose **Run on Demand**.

trans-unit.source: In the **File Upload** box, click the folder icon and browse to the zip file that contains your script.
trans-unit.target: In the **File Upload** box, click the folder icon and browse to the zip file that contains your script.

trans-unit.source: The zip file should contain your executable (.exe .cmd .bat .sh .php .py .js) as well as any supporting files needed to run the program or script.
trans-unit.target: The zip file should contain your executable (.exe .cmd .bat .sh .php .py .js) as well as any supporting files needed to run the program or script.

trans-unit.source: Check **Create** to upload the script to your web app.
trans-unit.target: Check **Create** to upload the script to your web app.

trans-unit.source: The name you specified for the WebJob appears in the list on the **WebJobs** blade.
trans-unit.target: The name you specified for the WebJob appears in the list on the **WebJobs** blade.

trans-unit.source: To run the WebJob, right-click its name in the list and click **Run**.
trans-unit.target: To run the WebJob, right-click its name in the list and click **Run**.

trans-unit.source: Run WebJob
trans-unit.target: Run WebJob

trans-unit.source: Create a continuously running WebJob
trans-unit.target: Create a continuously running WebJob

trans-unit.source: To create a continuously executing WebJob, follow the same steps for creating a WebJob that runs once, but in the **How to Run** box, choose **Continuous**.
trans-unit.target: To create a continuously executing WebJob, follow the same steps for creating a WebJob that runs once, but in the **How to Run** box, choose **Continuous**.

trans-unit.source: To start or stop a continuous WebJob, right-click the WebJob in the list and click **Start** or **Stop**.
trans-unit.target: To start or stop a continuous WebJob, right-click the WebJob in the list and click **Start** or **Stop**.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] If your web app runs on more than one instance, a continuously running WebJob will run on all of your instances.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] If your web app runs on more than one instance, a continuously running WebJob will run on all of your instances.

trans-unit.source: On-demand and scheduled WebJobs run on a single instance selected for load balancing by Microsoft Azure.
trans-unit.target: On-demand and scheduled WebJobs run on a single instance selected for load balancing by Microsoft Azure.

trans-unit.source: For Continuous WebJobs to run reliably and on all instances, enable the Always On* configuration setting for the web app otherwise they can stop running when the SCM host site has been idle for too long.
trans-unit.target: For Continuous WebJobs to run reliably and on all instances, enable the Always On* configuration setting for the web app otherwise they can stop running when the SCM host site has been idle for too long.

trans-unit.source: Create a scheduled WebJob
trans-unit.target: Create a scheduled WebJob

trans-unit.source: The Azure management portal doesn't yet have the ability to create a scheduled WebJob, but until that feature is added you can do it by using the [old portal](http://manage.windowsazure.com).
trans-unit.target: The Azure management portal doesn't yet have the ability to create a scheduled WebJob, but until that feature is added you can do it by using the [old portal](http://manage.windowsazure.com).

trans-unit.source: In the [old portal](http://manage.windowsazure.com) go to the WebJob page and click **Add**.
trans-unit.target: In the [old portal](http://manage.windowsazure.com) go to the WebJob page and click **Add**.

trans-unit.source: In the **How to Run** box, choose **Run on a schedule**.
trans-unit.target: In the **How to Run** box, choose **Run on a schedule**.

trans-unit.source: New Scheduled Job
trans-unit.target: New Scheduled Job

trans-unit.source: Choose the **Scheduler Region** for your job, and then click the arrow on the bottom right of the dialog to proceed to the next screen.
trans-unit.target: Choose the **Scheduler Region** for your job, and then click the arrow on the bottom right of the dialog to proceed to the next screen.

trans-unit.source: In the **Create Job** dialog, choose the type of **Recurrence** you want: **One-time job** or **Recurring job**.
trans-unit.target: In the **Create Job** dialog, choose the type of **Recurrence** you want: **One-time job** or **Recurring job**.

trans-unit.source: Schedule Recurrence
trans-unit.target: Schedule Recurrence

trans-unit.source: Also choose a **Starting** time: **Now** or **At a specific time**.
trans-unit.target: Also choose a **Starting** time: **Now** or **At a specific time**.

trans-unit.source: Schedule Start Time
trans-unit.target: Schedule Start Time

trans-unit.source: If you want to start at a specific time, choose your starting time values under **Starting On**.
trans-unit.target: If you want to start at a specific time, choose your starting time values under **Starting On**.

trans-unit.source: Schedule Start at a Specific Time
trans-unit.target: Schedule Start at a Specific Time

trans-unit.source: If you chose a recurring job, you have the **Recur Every** option to specify the frequency of occurrence and the **Ending On** option to specify an ending time.
trans-unit.target: If you chose a recurring job, you have the **Recur Every** option to specify the frequency of occurrence and the **Ending On** option to specify an ending time.

trans-unit.source: Schedule Recurrence
trans-unit.target: Schedule Recurrence

trans-unit.source: If you choose **Weeks**, you can select the **On a Particular Schedule** box and specify the days of the week that you want the job to run.
trans-unit.target: If you choose **Weeks**, you can select the **On a Particular Schedule** box and specify the days of the week that you want the job to run.

trans-unit.source: Schedule Days of the Week
trans-unit.target: Schedule Days of the Week

trans-unit.source: If you choose **Months** and select the **On a Particular Schedule** box, you can set the job to run on particular numbered **Days** in the month.
trans-unit.target: If you choose **Months** and select the **On a Particular Schedule** box, you can set the job to run on particular numbered **Days** in the month.

trans-unit.source: Schedule Particular Dates in the Month
trans-unit.target: Schedule Particular Dates in the Month

trans-unit.source: If you choose **Week Days**, you can select which day or days of the week in the month you want the job to run on.
trans-unit.target: If you choose **Week Days**, you can select which day or days of the week in the month you want the job to run on.

trans-unit.source: Schedule Particular Week Days in a Month
trans-unit.target: Schedule Particular Week Days in a Month

trans-unit.source: Finally, you can also use the **Occurrences** option to choose which week in the month (first, second, third etc.) you want the job to run on the week days you specified.
trans-unit.target: Finally, you can also use the **Occurrences** option to choose which week in the month (first, second, third etc.) you want the job to run on the week days you specified.

trans-unit.source: Schedule Particular Week Days on Particular Weeks in a Month
trans-unit.target: Schedule Particular Week Days on Particular Weeks in a Month

trans-unit.source: After you have created one or more jobs, their names will appear on the WebJobs tab with their status, schedule type, and other information.
trans-unit.target: After you have created one or more jobs, their names will appear on the WebJobs tab with their status, schedule type, and other information.

trans-unit.source: Historical information for the last 30 WebJobs is maintained.
trans-unit.target: Historical information for the last 30 WebJobs is maintained.

trans-unit.source: Jobs list
trans-unit.target: Jobs list

trans-unit.source: Scheduled jobs and Azure Scheduler
trans-unit.target: Scheduled jobs and Azure Scheduler

trans-unit.source: Scheduled jobs can be further configured in the Azure Scheduler pages of the [old portal](http://manage.windowsazure.com).
trans-unit.target: Scheduled jobs can be further configured in the Azure Scheduler pages of the [old portal](http://manage.windowsazure.com).

trans-unit.source: On the WebJobs page, click the job's **schedule** link to navigate to the Azure Scheduler portal page.
trans-unit.target: On the WebJobs page, click the job's **schedule** link to navigate to the Azure Scheduler portal page.

trans-unit.source: Link to Azure Scheduler
trans-unit.target: Link to Azure Scheduler

trans-unit.source: On the Scheduler page, click the job.
trans-unit.target: On the Scheduler page, click the job.

trans-unit.source: Job on the Scheduler portal page
trans-unit.target: Job on the Scheduler portal page

trans-unit.source: The **Job Action** page opens, where you can further configure the job.
trans-unit.target: The **Job Action** page opens, where you can further configure the job.

trans-unit.source: Job Action PageInScheduler
trans-unit.target: Job Action PageInScheduler

trans-unit.source: View the job history
trans-unit.target: View the job history

trans-unit.source: To view the execution history of a job, including jobs created with the WebJobs SDK, click its corresponding link under the **Logs** column of the WebJobs blade.
trans-unit.target: To view the execution history of a job, including jobs created with the WebJobs SDK, click its corresponding link under the **Logs** column of the WebJobs blade.

trans-unit.source: (You can use the clipboard icon to copy the URL of the log file page to the clipboard if you wish.)
trans-unit.target: (You can use the clipboard icon to copy the URL of the log file page to the clipboard if you wish.)

trans-unit.source: Logs link
trans-unit.target: Logs link

trans-unit.source: Clicking the link opens the details page for the WebJob.
trans-unit.target: Clicking the link opens the details page for the WebJob.

trans-unit.source: This page shows you the name of the command run, the last times it ran, and its success or failure.
trans-unit.target: This page shows you the name of the command run, the last times it ran, and its success or failure.

trans-unit.source: Under **Recent job runs**, click a time to see further details.
trans-unit.target: Under **Recent job runs**, click a time to see further details.

trans-unit.source: WebJobDetails
trans-unit.target: WebJobDetails

trans-unit.source: The **WebJob Run Details** page appears.
trans-unit.target: The **WebJob Run Details** page appears.

trans-unit.source: Click **Toggle Output** to see the text of the log contents.
trans-unit.target: Click **Toggle Output** to see the text of the log contents.

trans-unit.source: The output log is in text format.
trans-unit.target: The output log is in text format.

trans-unit.source: Web job run details
trans-unit.target: Web job run details

trans-unit.source: To see the output text in a separate browser window, click the **download** link.
trans-unit.target: To see the output text in a separate browser window, click the **download** link.

trans-unit.source: To download the text itself, right-click the link and use your browser options to save the file contents.
trans-unit.target: To download the text itself, right-click the link and use your browser options to save the file contents.

trans-unit.source: Download log output
trans-unit.target: Download log output

trans-unit.source: The **WebJobs** link at the top of the page provides a convenient way to get to a list of WebJobs on the history dashboard.
trans-unit.target: The **WebJobs** link at the top of the page provides a convenient way to get to a list of WebJobs on the history dashboard.

trans-unit.source: Link to WebJobs list
trans-unit.target: Link to WebJobs list

trans-unit.source: List of WebJobs in history dashboard
trans-unit.target: List of WebJobs in history dashboard

trans-unit.source: Clicking one of these links takes you to the WebJob Details page for the job you selected.
trans-unit.target: Clicking one of these links takes you to the WebJob Details page for the job you selected.

trans-unit.source: Notes
trans-unit.target: Notes

trans-unit.source: Web apps in Free mode can time out after 20 minutes if there are no requests to the scm (deployment) site and the web app's portal is not open in Azure.
trans-unit.target: Web apps in Free mode can time out after 20 minutes if there are no requests to the scm (deployment) site and the web app's portal is not open in Azure.

trans-unit.source: Requests to the actual site will not reset this.
trans-unit.target: Requests to the actual site will not reset this.

trans-unit.source: Code for a continuous job needs to be written to run in an endless loop.
trans-unit.target: Code for a continuous job needs to be written to run in an endless loop.

trans-unit.source: Continuous jobs run continuously only when the web app is up.
trans-unit.target: Continuous jobs run continuously only when the web app is up.

trans-unit.source: Basic and Standard modes offer the Always On feature which, when enabled, prevents web apps from becoming idle.
trans-unit.target: Basic and Standard modes offer the Always On feature which, when enabled, prevents web apps from becoming idle.

trans-unit.source: You can only debug continuously running WebJobs.
trans-unit.target: You can only debug continuously running WebJobs.

trans-unit.source: Debugging scheduled or on-demand WebJobs is not supported.
trans-unit.target: Debugging scheduled or on-demand WebJobs is not supported.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] If you want to get started with Azure App Service before signing up for an Azure account, go to [Try App Service](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=523751), where you can immediately create a short-lived starter web app in App Service.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] If you want to get started with Azure App Service before signing up for an Azure account, go to [Try App Service](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=523751), where you can immediately create a short-lived starter web app in App Service.

trans-unit.source: No credit cards required; no commitments.
trans-unit.target: No credit cards required; no commitments.

trans-unit.source: Next Steps
trans-unit.target: Next Steps

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Azure WebJobs Recommended Resources][WebJobsRecommendedResources].
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Azure WebJobs Recommended Resources][WebJobsRecommendedResources].

trans-unit.target: What's changed

trans-unit.target: For a guide to the change from Websites to App Service see: [Azure App Service and Its Impact on Existing Azure Services](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=529714)

trans-unit.target: For a guide to the change of the old portal to the new portal see: [Reference for navigating the preview portal](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=529715)

trans-unit.target: test
